swen221.cardgame.cards.core

Class Trick

  • java.lang.Object
    • swen221.cardgame.cards.core.Trick
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Trick
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a trick being played. This includes the cards that have been played so far, as well as what the suit of trumps is for this trick.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trick(Player.Direction lead, Card.Suit trumps)
      Contruct a new trick with a given lead player and suit of trumps.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Card getCardPlayed(Player.Direction p)
      Get the card played by a given player, or null if that player has yet to play.
      java.util.List<Card> getCardsPlayed()
      Get the list of cards played so far in the order they were played.
      Player.Direction getLeadPlayer()
      Determine who the lead player for this trick is.
      Player.Direction getNextToPlay()
      Determine the next player to play in this trick.
      Card.Suit getTrumps()
      Determine which suit are trumps for this trick, or null if there are no trumps.
      Player.Direction getWinner()
      Determine the winning player for this trick.
      void play(Player p, Card c)
      Player attempts to play a card.

      • getWinner

        public Player.Direction getWinner()
        Determine the winning player for this trick. This requires looking to see which player led the highest card that followed suit; or, was a trump.
        Returns:

      • play

        public void play(Player p,
                 Card c)
          throws IllegalMove
        Player attempts to play a card. This method checks that the given player is entitled to play, and that the played card follows suit. If either of these are not true, it throws an IllegalMove exception.
        Parameters:
        p - Player
        c - Card
        Throws:
        IllegalMove
